repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The volume 2 of a 2-volume Naṉṉūl. It contains the Collatikāram. The volume 1 is BnF Indien 179.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2023).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals foliation and parallel Arabic numerals foliation.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Naṉṉūl, Collatikāram: Title Page in French. No foliation. Verso blank. 415 x 30 mm.

203 folios = Naṉṉūl, Collatikāram: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-203. Parallel Arabic foliation 1-178.1, 178.2, 180-203. No foilio foliated 179 (foliated 178.2 by oversight). f203v blank. 415 x 30 mm.
2 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. 415 x 30 mm.

additions.desc:
Description of contents and bundle on a detached sheet of paper (190 x 80 mm):
mr Ducler N° 29
intitulé Nannoule, ou grammaire, Tamoul,
1ere Partie
Ejoutiyal ou orthographie,
(ouvrage anonyme) contenant 166 feuilles, This description is here misplaced and in fact describes the first volume of this 2-volume manuscript, that is, BnF Indien 179.
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 180 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Original brown rosewood covers. 415 x 30 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson (1868) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably Ducler's provenance). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 71.

listBibl.bibl: Naṉṉūl. 1860 (Irauttiri yr. Āvaṇi m.). Naṉṉūl Viruttiyurai of Pavaṇanti. Ed. Āṟumukanāvalar. 3rd printing. Ceṉṉapaṭṭaṇam (Chennai): Vittiyānupālaṉayantiracālai.

Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10: 84-91. — See p. 88, no. 6: 6. Nannoule, ou grammaire malabare, IIe partie, étymologie; 203 feuilles.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 57, nos. 179-180.

D'Avella, Victor B. 2020. Orbiting Material in Tamil Grammatical Texts, in Colophons, Prefaces, Satellite Stanzas edited by Eva Wilden and Suganya Anandakichenin, pp. 223-280. Hamburg: Department of Indian and Tibetan Studies, Universität Hamburg (Indian and Tibetan Studies 10).
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 17, no. 30.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 44r, nos. 179, 180.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 44, nos. 179, 180. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, March 2023.

ab.seg:
Grammaire Malabare.this last word crossed-out by a later hand, in black ink
Etymologie.
